# Customizing ggplots {.maize}

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
theme_set(theme_gray())
```

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true
ggplot(StorySpoilers, aes(x = Original, y = Spoiler)) + 
  geom_point()
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true
ggplot(StorySpoilers, aes(x = Original, y = Spoiler)) + 
  geom_point(size = 4)
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true
ggplot(StorySpoilers, aes(x = Original, y = Spoiler)) + 
  geom_point(size = 4) + 
  theme_minimal()
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
ggplot(StorySpoilers, aes(x = Original, y = Spoiler)) + 
  geom_point(size = 4) + 
  theme_minimal(base_size = 20)
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true
ggplot(StorySpoilers, aes(x = Original, y = Spoiler)) + 
  geom_point(size = 4) + 
  theme_minimal(base_size = 20, base_family = "Roboto Slab")
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true
ggplot(StorySpoilers, aes(x = Original, y = Spoiler)) + 
  geom_point(size = 4) + 
  theme_minimal(base_size = 20, base_family = "Roboto Slab") +
  labs(
    x = "Original Version",
    y = "Version with Spoilers",
    title = "Enjoyment of Stories with Spoilers vs Original"
  )
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true
ggplot(StorySpoilers, aes(x = Original, y = Spoiler)) + 
  geom_point(size = 4) + 
  geom_abline(slope = 1, intercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", col = "darkgray") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 20, base_family = "Roboto Slab") +
  labs(
    x = "Original Version",
    y = "Version with Spoilers",
    title = "Enjoyment of Stories with Spoilers vs Original"
  )
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}


## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}

  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE)
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}

  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +

```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}

#| fig-height: 5

```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, col = species)) + 
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + 
  theme_bw() + 
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") +
  scale_color_viridis_d(end = .75)
```

## `palatteer` package

https://r-graph-gallery.com/color-palette-finder

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true

library(paletteer)
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, col = species)) + 
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + 
  theme_bw() + 
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") + 
  scale_colour_paletteer_d("palettetown::nuzleaf") 
```

## Take a sad plot and make it better {auto-animate="true"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 5
#| echo: true

library(paletteer)
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, col = species)) + 
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + 
  theme_bw() + 
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") + 
  scale_colour_paletteer_d("palettetown::nuzleaf") +
  labs(
    x = "Body Mass (g)",
    y = "Flipper Length (mm)",
    col = "",
    title = "Relationship of Body Mass to Flipper Length",
    subtitle = "Among 3 different species in the Palmer Archipelago"
  )
```

## In `esquisse`

Change theme under the "theme" menu:

```{r}

```

## In `esquisse`

Change color palette under the "geometries" menu:

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("images/esquisse-geometries.png")
```

## In `esquisse`

Change title and axis labels under the "labels and title" menu:

